bibl.title: State and Aristocracy from the Late Empire to Byzantium.
bibl.note: The economic revival of the late antique period was closely bound up with its monetary history. The new eastern aristocracy owed its existence to the state and was bound to it by a strong sense of patrimonial loyalty.

bibl.title: Production and Public Powers in Classical Antiquity

bibl.seg: BANAJI Jairus, State and Aristocracy from the Late Empire to Byzantium.
Elio LO CASCIO and Dominic W. RATHBONE (Edd.), Production and Public Powers in Classical Antiquity = Cambridge Philological Society. Suppl. 26 (Cambridge, 2000) pp. 92-99.

The economic revival of the late antique period was closely bound up with its monetary history. The new eastern aristocracy owed its existence to the state and was bound to it by a strong sense of patrimonial loyalty.
